alert.note: Alert for Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 2:51PM CST until January 14 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches, except 13 to 20 inches for northern Iron county. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Iron County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the northwestern area of the Lac du Flambeau Band. * WHEN...Until midnight CST Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
